text: jīva jāga, jīva jāga, gorāchā̐da bale
translation: Śrī Gorāchā̐d calls, “O souls, awake! O souls, awake! How long will you sleep in the clutches of the witch Māyā?

text: (uṭha jīva, kṛṣṇa bhaja ār kata kāl ghumāibe?)
translation: "How much longer will you sleep? How much longer will you sleep in the lap of the witch Māyā? Arise soul! Serve Kṛṣṇa! How much longer will you sleep?
“You came into this world saying, ‘O Lord, I will serve You’, but, having forgotten this promise, you have remained in ignorance.
“You forgot and remained. You fell into illusion’s bewilderment, forgot (your promise), and remained there.

text: āmi vinā bandhu āra ke āchhe tomāra
translation: “I have descended to save you. Other than Me, who is your friend?

text: (māyā-ha-ite uddhārite eman bandhu ār ke āchhe?)
translation: “Who else is such a friend? Who else is there to rescue you from Māyā?
“I have brought the medicine to dispel Māyā. Pray for this Hari-nām mahāmantra and take it.
“Pray and take it. Pray for the Holy Name, which is dripping with nectar, and take it.”
Bhakti Vinod falls at the Lord’s feet, prays for the Hari-nām mahāmantra, and takes it.
